Edited January 16, 2014 by Tada

You could've provided screenshots that focused closer on the spacecraft and less on the empty space around the Launch Pad.

A problem I see with the design is that its inheirently asymetrical without a compensatory angling of the engines, which means all the way through the launch you'll be losing delta-v for corrections. But it does seem quite cute and novel to have a shuttle with only a strap-on seat to the top.
Closer pics from the side and front while in flight would be nice.

It looks like the mass of the Shuttle is so minuscule it doesn't matter. The shuttle body is made of Oscar-B tanks.

Also to panzerknoef, how am I supposed to get this save to work, is it a world save file or a craft file?

Edited January 16, 2014 by Tank Buddy
It's a craft file, the compensation is provided by rcs and reaction wheels. I will upload some better pictures when i have some time.
I found that if you detach, rotate the plane so that pitching up changes your heading, turn on SAS, and do so, you have an infiniglider.
